reviewText: Upon re-evaluating the game, it's not as bad as I initially thought. Most of my problems come from the game being D-Pad exclusive, making it a pain to play on an Xbox 360 controller. The backgrounds are actually decently detailed, and the character sprites are pretty great. The game runs really well at a solid 60 fps, which is impressive for what seems to be this developer's first project.\n\nI do think the text needs better translation though, and a dash button should be added as well, or change the button combonation to make it go. But seeing how the developer is actually taking into consideration feedback to improve the game down the line, rather than leaving it in its average state shows the dedication from them to make an actually solid game.
voteText: 8 of 10 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Product received for free

Full Disclosure: I received a review code for this game from the developer at my request.

Looking for your Megaman fix? Not thrilled with what happened on Mighty No. 9?

Then I've got a deal for you, my friends.

This is Metagal, from freshman developer RetroRevolution. They're an Indian developer that decided that rather than tackle an MMO,  they were going to do a thing, do it well, and move on. As a result, they've delivered on what they claimed: A game that looks a bit like Megaman, plays a lot like Megaman, and still does its own thing in its own peculiar way.

Right down to the nasty case of Nintendo Hard it seems to have picked up from the original Megaman games. Sitting down to play this game made me feel like a teenager again-- all the way down to the Epic Fail getting much of anywhere.

For upsides, there's a fair list-- Hardcore Megaman/Metroidvania players will love the vertical difficulty curve (it's not playing around here) post-tutorial, solid look and gameplay, and a bad habit of killing you if you stop to think things through.

As for the cons, I only have two complaints: a very small native resolution and a bit of slop in the controls. The first is correctable with the maximize button (no fullscreen) and antialiasing, while the second might just be me. Your mileage may vary.

https://youtu.be/sL1E9iT375U

EDIT: It's come to my attention that there's a spot in the Tutorial that caused a drop through the scenery for some users. I did not see it, and haven't been able to duplicate it.

reviewText: You already know what you're in for when looking at this, right? Like Legend of Dark Witch (another highly recommended Mega Man-like Run n' Gun for super cheap) this is a basically a gender swapped Mega Man. It's a retro-style run n' gun platformer pitting your mechanized heroine against a bunch of Android Gals" vs. Mega Man's various dude Robot Masters (excluding MM9's Splash Woman).  Unlike Dark Witch
date: which adds in it's own ideas (like a Gradius style upgrade bar) this one sticks to the MM formula pretty much exclusively. But it does pretty well!\n\nVisually it looks fantastic; the pixel art here and the color palette used is as good as
hoursPlayed: genuine SNES/Genesis/Amiga quality. The chibi character art really evoke cute
voteText: Japanese sidescrollers from the era. The quality of the chiptunes is great too. Controls are absolutely on point. They're super responsive and tight; it feels great with a 360 controller. The levels are very well designed
helpfulPercent: with areas being themed around various classic MM stage hazards like timed drop platforms
votesHelpful: flame throwers and conveyor belt sections. Once you defeat the four main Gals and move onto the levels beyond
votesTotal: they even start making great use of your powers! See a wall you seemingly can't get passed? Fire the black hole-thing at an enemy on the other side to switch places and warp over there! See a gap that's too large for a dash jump? Jump anyway
votesFunny: then use Magma Gal's Flame Dash to cross to the other side! A ladder you can't reach? Shoot out your Mines
commentsCount: then jump on them to use the explosion to give you a boost! It gets REALLY GOOD once you have all these powers; the levels know that
column17: enemies are positioned in ways and combinations that almost resemble an "action puzzle"; they'll shoot bouncing projectiles to get you to move to certain safe spots or you'll be able to perfectly take them out one-at-a-time from certain vantage points. It's just like the good old days! Speaking of
column18: the difficulty is tuned to be "NES Hard"; really difficult
column19: but never impossible and rewarding when conquered (and able to be more speedily conquered after you get it down). Sit there and watch patterns
column21: or die and learn from failures when you try again: you WILL make progress... most of the time.\n\nThere are *some* issues that affect the difficulty. The timing windows on some of this stuff is absolutely brutal (particularly the fullscreen flame throwers in the second half of Magma Gal's stage and the explosive

but it bares mentioning anyway.

column30: it's definitely recommended if you're looking for a cheap Mega Man style run-n'-gun retro action game. This is an extremely well-crafted little game and definitely provides the fun and challenge you're looking for. This title could absolutely go for $10 and it would put some other games in that price range to shame. RetroRevolution has a quality game here for the price of a sandwich at Burger King. I hope this isn't the last we see of Meta Gal :)"

reviewText:
It still released faster than Mighty No. 9.

EDIT: Since only one person found this helpful, I suppose I could go into detail.

It controls pretty well, although I got used to the double-tap dashing rather than the button. Expect Mega Man, for the most part.

I did like how abilities work, and anticipated getting a new one due to the fact that a lot of them help you get around the stages (like Warp Gal's weapon swaps the places between you and an enemy it hit).

I liked the sprite work, although felt it lacked color, but this might be my own preferences toward the 8-Bit Mega Man games.

The story is pretty basic, although I liked the attempts to give it color by injecting humor, although I'd have referenced some common Mega Man oddities (like why do they all have a Fortress?). The English was also a bit wonky, but the devs said English isn't their first language, so I can't criticize that.

The difficulty was hard, as a Mega Man throwback usually is, although sometimes I thought the game got pretty unfair, although those are usually late-game (the pseudo-Quick Man lasers particularly annoyed me in the third Creeper stage). I might also suck at platformers.

I'd check it out, since it's at a pretty low price, and I'm definitely looking forward to seeing the new playable characters in later updates.

...And it also still released faster than Mighty No. 9.

reviewText:
Pros.

Cheap.

Classic-ish megaman style game play.

Good OST.

Cons.

Uses a dash, the dash is ONLY through double tapping left or right and is needed for a good junk of platforming.

You start with 0 lives (gifted one in tutorial) dying sets you to certain check points, if you use Continue. Rebirth not 100% what it does but it is a life system. Check points are really far apart compared to the amount of instant death traps in the game.

Says it is mapped for controllers. You can only use D-pad for movement (left right, up and down for ladders) So it really isn't full controller support.

Overall.

Would be a perfect little jump shoot platformer if you could assign dashing to a button.

reviewText:
I bought this game based on the artwork and price alone. (That and I love platformers. ^_^ ) After playing it for a while, though, I had some concerns that I mentioned in a video. You can check it out here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nIcqbSm-fvQ

TL;DR
-----------------------------------------------
- It's a love letter to Mega Man X, which I really like.
- Artwork is great as is the music. Fun stuff!
- UI inconsistencies can be frustrating.
- Seems to be a delay in shooting and jumping.
- Enemies respawn REALLY fast.
- Screen transitions can be really jarring.
- Cool game overall, but little details prevent it from feeling fantastic.
---------------------------------------------

This is just my opinion, and everything is said from a position of love. I hear the devs are improving the game all the time and addressing these concerns, so it's exciting to see where this game will end up!

reviewText:
Product received for free

Disclaimer: I received a key from the developer for livestreaming purposes.

Metagal ended up being exactly what I hoped it would be.  I was looking for a game that paid homage to the old Megaman games of old.  Metagal does this in its own way but retains the feel (and difficulty) of those games.

It's not perfect.  There are some bugs and some issues with grammer.  I did feel like the controls are a bit sluggish.  Shooting while jumping felt a bit off, as did dash jumping.  It felt like it could be me but I noticed a few others mentioned it so it might need to be tweaked.  I didn't run into any gamebreaking bugs.  Just some minor ones but they were there.

That said they nail most everything else that matters.  The weapons are integrated pretty well into the gameplay.  There are plenty of secrets to find.  The stages and the bosses are diffcult but actually fair.  I got plenty frustrated doing each one over and over but at the same time I learned more about each fight and by the end knew exactly what I needed to do.  The look of the game might as well have come right out of the past.  The overarching feel of the game was great.  It's a great deal at the price as well.

I believe it's worth the price ($3.99) at the moment if you are looking for a good Megaman type game.  It does more than enough right to overlook the current issues in my estimation.  If you're not sure check back again after a patch or two and try it then.  It's certainly worth giving a shot.
voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This is a fun little game with two notable problems.
Metagal is a Mega Man homage and unashamed of it. It is a 2d run and gun platformer with a health bar, boss gates, stage select and the other trappings you find in any good game staring a blue robot. Little new ground has been broken but the engine feels more like a late GBA game than the familar NES classics and fangames.
The visuals, sound, and controls all meet expectations. The backgrounds are rich and vibrant while enemy designs are consistent and charming. The songs have strong melodies and good instrumentation. The controls are responsive and tight. Sometimes the shots can feel a bit delayed but it seems to be more a matter of projectile speed and animation than input delay.

The game has two significant failings: text and dash.
Text- The developers clearly do not use english as their first language -and I support game development all over the world- but if they want to market the game  as professionals they need to hire an editor to check their spelling and grammar. Thankfully the story is not the main attraction of the game and the tutorial conveys enough meaning to teach you.
Dash- To dash in the game tou need to double-tap forward. There is no other option. No ability to bind to a button. No ability to bind down + jump.  Every controller that supports this game has enough buttons to bind an additional but the option is absent. Some may find this to be inconsequential but I see it as a clumsy barrier tangling gameplay. (EDIT: they are already working on the dash button patch)

All things considered it is still a functional and cheap game that should be worth picking up if you are a mega fan running out of fangames.

reviewText: Very Mega Man in many ways! Obviously an homage to the blue bot, this game challenges you just like the old days. Character designs are cute and the story is very familiar if your a MM fan like myself. Definitely worth a buy if you ask me! :D

reviewText:
I have played megaman 1 - 8 , Megaman X 1 - 6 , Megaman power up.
As for metagal , after the Dev add in the new dash button , I find this game feel a lot like a megaman-X style game. I dont mind its a megaman-X clone , because I really enjoy this game like how I enjoy the other megaman-X games.

Although there are still some minor things that I not really like about this game :
* such as U cant shot only 1 single bullet, but U shot 3 bullet every time U press the shot button. I prefer 1 bullet shot as sometimes we need to aim our jump shot. For this game , most of the time, out of 3 bullet , only 1 bullet hit enemy ( when U jump shot small enemy or small target such as the mid boss eye at GAL.03  ).
* the bullet meter bar drain too fast.

but at least it is on the right track to become a good megaman-X clone game. ( in my opinion, so far this is the best megaman-X clone game I know )
